description: Starts a job run. A job run is a unit of work, such as a Spark jar, PySpark script, or SparkSQL query, that you submit to Amazon EMR on EKS.

parameters.name: virtualClusterId
parameters.description: The virtual cluster ID for which the job run request is submitted.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: The client idempotency token of the job run request. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: jobDriver
parameters.description: The job driver for the job run. sparkSubmitJobDriver (dict) --- The job driver parameters specified for spark submit. The entry point of job application. entryPointArguments (list) --- The arguments for job application. (string) --- sparkSubmitParameters (string) --- The Spark submit parameters that are used for job runs. sparkSqlJobDriver (dict) --- The job driver for job type. entryPoint (string) --- The SQL file to be executed. sparkSqlParameters (string) --- The Spark parameters to be included in the Spark SQL command.

nested_params.name: sparkSubmitJobDriver
nested_params.description: The job driver parameters specified for spark submit.

nested_params.name: entryPoint
nested_params.description: The entry point of job application.

nested_params.name: entryPointArguments
nested_params.description: The arguments for job application.

nested_params.name: sparkSubmitParameters
nested_params.description: The Spark submit parameters that are used for job runs.

nested_params.name: sparkSqlJobDriver
nested_params.description: The job driver for job type.

nested_params.name: entryPoint
nested_params.description: The SQL file to be executed.

nested_params.name: sparkSqlParameters
nested_params.description: The Spark parameters to be included in the Spark SQL command.

parameters.name: configurationOverrides
parameters.description: The configuration overrides for the job run. applicationConfiguration (list) --- The configurations for the application running by the job run. (dict) --- A configuration specification to be used when provisioning virtual clusters, which can include configurations for applications and software bundled with Amazon EMR on EKS. A configuration consists of a classification, properties, and optional nested configurations. A classification refers to an application-specific configuration file. Properties are the settings you want to change in that file. The classification within a configuration. properties (dict) --- A set of properties specified within a configuration classification. (string) --- (string) --- configurations (list) --- A list of additional configurations to apply within a configuration object. monitoringConfiguration (dict) --- The configurations for monitoring. managedLogs (dict) --- The entity that controls configuration for managed logs. allowAWSToRetainLogs (string) --- Determines whether Amazon Web Services can retain logs. encryptionKeyArn (string) --- The Amazon resource name (ARN) of the encryption key for logs. persistentAppUI (string) --- Monitoring configurations for the persistent application UI. cloudWatchMonitoringConfiguration (dict) --- Monitoring configurations for CloudWatch. The name of the log group for log publishing. logStreamNamePrefix (string) --- The specified name prefix for log streams. s3MonitoringConfiguration (dict) --- Amazon S3 configuration for monitoring log publishing. Amazon S3 destination URI for log publishing. containerLogRotationConfiguration (dict) --- Enable or disable container log rotation. The file size at which to rotate logs. Minimum of 2KB, Maximum of 2GB. The number of files to keep in container after rotation.

nested_params.name: applicationConfiguration
nested_params.description: The configurations for the application running by the job run.

nested_params.name: classification
nested_params.description: The classification within a configuration.

nested_params.name: properties
nested_params.description: A set of properties specified within a configuration classification.

nested_params.name: configurations
nested_params.description: A list of additional configurations to apply within a configuration object.

nested_params.name: monitoringConfiguration
nested_params.description: The configurations for monitoring.

nested_params.name: managedLogs
nested_params.description: The entity that controls configuration for managed logs.

nested_params.name: allowAWSToRetainLogs
nested_params.description: Determines whether Amazon Web Services can retain logs.

nested_params.name: encryptionKeyArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon resource name (ARN) of the encryption key for logs.

nested_params.name: persistentAppUI
nested_params.description: Monitoring configurations for the persistent application UI.

nested_params.name: cloudWatchMonitoringConfiguration
nested_params.description: Monitoring configurations for CloudWatch.

nested_params.name: logGroupName
nested_params.description: The name of the log group for log publishing.

nested_params.name: logStreamNamePrefix
nested_params.description: The specified name prefix for log streams.

nested_params.name: s3MonitoringConfiguration
nested_params.description: Amazon S3 configuration for monitoring log publishing.

nested_params.name: logUri
nested_params.description: Amazon S3 destination URI for log publishing.

nested_params.name: containerLogRotationConfiguration
nested_params.description: Enable or disable container log rotation.

nested_params.name: rotationSize
nested_params.description: The file size at which to rotate logs. Minimum of 2KB, Maximum of 2GB.

nested_params.name: maxFilesToKeep
nested_params.description: The number of files to keep in container after rotation.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: The tags assigned to job runs. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: jobTemplateParameters
parameters.description: The values of job template parameters to start a job run. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: retryPolicyConfiguration
parameters.description: The retry policy configuration for the job run. The maximum number of attempts on the job's driver.

nested_params.name: maxAttempts
nested_params.description: The maximum number of attempts on the job's driver.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: This output displays the started job run ID.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: This output displays the name of the started job run.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: This output lists the ARN of job run.

nested_items.name: virtualClusterId
nested_items.description: This output displays the virtual cluster ID for which the job run was submitted.
